abstract.p: Letter from Ralston H Deffenbaugh Jr (Lutheran Immigration and Refugee Service) scores as grossly inadequate the Clinton administration response to refugee crisis abroad (June 17 editorial)

block.p: I hope ''Africa's Swelling Refugee Crisis'' (editorial, June 17) increases awareness of this problem and the parsimony of the international response. The Clinton administration has made a deplorably inadequate budget proposal that would cut overseas assistance to protect African refugees by nearly $14 million.

I hope ''Africa's Swelling Refugee Crisis'' (editorial, June 17) increases awareness of this problem and the parsimony of the international response. The Clinton administration has made a deplorably inadequate budget proposal that would cut overseas assistance to protect African refugees by nearly $14 million.

The administration would also continue the steady decline in resettlement admissions, reducing by up to 9,000 the number of refugees from around the world who would be able to start a new life in this country when returning to their own is not a viable option. Republican counterproposals threaten to cut refugee protection and resettlement even further.
RALSTON H. DEFFENBAUGH JR. Baltimore, June 19, 2000
The writer is president of the Lutheran Immigration and Refugee Service.
